title: Role Flexibility vs. Role Clarity
content: Clear roles don't mean rigid roles. Teams need both clarity about normal responsibilities and flexibility to adapt when conditions change. The key is intentional shifting: explicitly acknowledging when someone takes on different responsibilities, so nothing falls through gaps.

mcq.question: During high workload, you start helping with tasks outside your normal role. What should happen?

options.B: Communicate the shift so your normal responsibilities are covered
options.C: Stick to your role—that's what clarity means
options.D: Help if asked but don't volunteer

mcq.explanation: Flexibility requires communication. If you shift to help elsewhere, someone needs to know your normal tasks might be uncovered. Explicit role shifting maintains coordination while enabling adaptation.

openQuestions: How does your team handle role flexibility during unusual situations?
When have unclear role shifts caused problems?
